definition[1]: to be at a distance from other objects or buildings
example[1]: The house stood alone at the end of the road.
definition[2]: to continue to do something alone, without help from anyone else
example[2]: Some of the Pacific islands are too small to stand alone as independent states.
definition[3]: to be much better than anything or anyone else
example[3]: For sheer entertainment value, Kelly stood alone.
definition[4]: a stand-alone computer works without being part of a NETWORK (=a set of computers connected to each other)
example[4]: The Macintosh, a desktop computer, is usually a stand-alone machine.
definition[5]: a stand-alone company or business is one that is not part of a large CORPORATION
example[5]: It is difficult for a stand-alone company our size to get to profitability.
